questions.question_text: Since CCM allows cloud customers to build a detailed list of requirements and controls to be implemented by the CSP as part of their overall third-party risk management and procurement program, will CCM alone be enough to define all the items to be considered when operating/using cloud services?

discussion.content:

Shoud be D. The CCM allows cloud customers to build a detailed list of requirements and controls they want their CSP to
implement as part of their overall third-party risk management and procurement program. It also helps normalize
security expectations, provide a cloud taxonomy, and improve understanding of the security measures implemented
in the cloud supply chain.

Selected Answer: D
D. No. CCM can serve as a foundation for a cloud assessment program, but it needs to be completed with requirements applicable to each company.

While the Cloud Controls Matrix (CCM) provides a comprehensive framework for cloud security and helps in building a detailed list of requirements and controls, it should be supplemented with specific requirements tailored to each company's unique needs and regulatory environment. questions.question_text: During an audit it was identified that a critical application hosted in an off-premises cloud is not part of the organization’s DRP (Disaster Recovery Plan). Management stated that it is responsible for ensuring that the cloud service provider (CSP) has a plan that is tested annually. What should be the auditor’s NEXT course of action?

choices.D: Plan an audit of the CSP.
choices.B: Review the security white paper of the CSP.
choices.C: Review the contract and DR capability.

comments.content: it is not outsourced, Management stated

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
As per CCAK page 335, if BCP/ DR is outsourced, CSP to provide latest assurance report

Selected Answer: C
C. Review the contract and DR capability.

The auditor should first review the contract and the disaster recovery (DR) capability to understand the specific terms and commitments made by the cloud service provider (CSP) regarding disaster recovery. This includes verifying whether the CSP has a tested DR plan, the responsibilities of both the organization and the CSP, and any related service level agreements (SLAs). This step is crucial to ensure that all necessary DR measures are in place and are compliant with the organization's requirements and expectations.

Selected Answer: C
I go with C

Selected Answer: C
The answer to the question is C. The auditor's NEXT course of action should be to review the contract and DR capability. This information can be found on page 329 of the Certificate of Cloud Auditing Knowledge Study Guide.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the BEST recommendation to offer an organization’s HR department planning to adopt a new public SaaS application to ease the recruiting process?

choices.D: Do not allow data to be in cleratext
choices.B: Implement a cloud access security broker

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Consult the legal department

Consulting the legal department is the best recommendation because adopting a new public SaaS application for recruiting may involve various legal and compliance issues, such as data privacy, data protection regulations, and contractual obligations. The legal department can provide guidance on these aspects, ensuring that the organization remains compliant with all relevant laws and regulations while using the new application. This step helps mitigate potential legal risks and ensures that the HR department's use of the SaaS application aligns with the organization's overall legal framework.

Selected Answer: C
The legal department can provide guidance on the legal and regulatory requirements that apply to the organization’s recruitment process. This includes ensuring that the SaaS application is compliant with relevant regulations such as GDPR, CCPA, and other data privacy laws. The legal department can also review the terms and conditions of the SaaS application to ensure that they are acceptable to the organization.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the BEST tool to perform cloud security control audits?
In which control should a cloud service provider, upon request, inform customers of compliance impact and risk, especially if customer data is used as part of the services?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Compliance control

The compliance control is responsible for ensuring that the cloud service provider (CSP) informs customers about the compliance impact and associated risks, particularly when customer data is used as part of the services. This control ensures that the CSP meets regulatory requirements and helps customers understand how their data is being handled, thereby enabling them to manage their compliance obligations effectively.

Selected Answer: D
The Compliance control is responsible for ensuring that the CSP is compliant with relevant regulations and standards, and that customer data is protected from unauthorized access, disclosure, and modification. The Compliance control is also responsible for ensuring that the CSP’s security controls are effective and that the CSP is able to meet its contractual obligations.
